importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Naroditsky earned international acclaim as the under-12 World Youth Chess Champion in 2007, establishing himself as one of the country’s most promising young talents.
Naroditsky graduated from Stanford University with a bachelor’s degree in history in 2019.
The New York Times hired Naroditsky as a chess columnist in 2022, highlighting his growing influence in mainstream media.
The 2025 US Chess Championship opened with a moment of silence in his honor, indicating his lasting impact on competitive chess.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: From 2007 to 2019, Naroditsky developed from a young prodigy to a university-educated chess grandmaster and educator, shaping the modern era of accessible, online chess instruction.

keyTakeAways: Daniel Naroditsky, a prominent American chess grandmaster, died at the age of 29.
He earned the grandmaster title before high school graduation and won multiple national youth championships.
He gained international recognition as the under-12 World Youth Chess Champion in 2007.
Naroditsky graduated from Stanford University with a degree in history in 2019.
He authored a chess manual at age 14 and became a regular contributor to Chess Life and the New York Times as a chess columnist.
He built a massive online following with nearly half a million YouTube subscribers and 340,000 Twitch followers, livestreaming games and making complex strategies accessible.
The International Chess Federation and the Saint Louis Chess Club publicly honored his contributions to the chess community.
The 2025 US Chess Championship opened with a moment of silence in his memory, underscoring his influence on competitive chess.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Daniel Naroditsky, a 29-year-old American chess grandmaster born in the San Francisco Bay Area, died unexpectedly. He earned the grandmaster title before high school and gained global recognition as the under-12 World Youth Chess Champion in 2007. After attending Stanford University and earning a history degree in 2019, Naroditsky became a prolific chess educator, author, and media presence through platforms like YouTube and Twitch, where he amassed over half a million subscribers and 340,000 followers. His accessible teaching style and livestreamed gameplay brought chess to a broad, global audience. The International Chess Federation and the Saint Louis Chess Club publicly honored his legacy, and the 2025 US Chess Championship began with a moment of silence in his memory, reflecting his profound influence on both the competitive and educational aspects of modern chess.
title: American chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky dies at 29
